snippet: The identity of a witness who had helped prosecutors in an organized crime case was subsequently disclosed in a civil lawsuit.
abstract: Federal Judge Brian M Cogan has asked United States attorney's office in Brooklyn to review whether to pursue criminal contempt charges against Frederick M Oberlander, lawyer who revealed in court papers in 2010 the identity of a businessman who had pleaded guilty in an organized-crime case and cooperated with the government.

byline.original: By COLIN MOYNIHAN and BENJAMIN WEISER

lead_paragraph: The identity of a witness who had helped prosecutors in an organized crime case was subsequently disclosed in a civil lawsuit.

headline.seo: Charges Considered for Lawyer Who Revealed Witness’s Name
headline.main: Charges Weighed for Lawyer Who Revealed Witness’s Name
headline.print_headline: Charges Weighed for Lawyer Who Revealed Witness’s Name
